intro: Tetracanthus linearifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed tetracanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. The botanical features of Tetracanthus linearifolius make it an important species in the study of tropical flora and ecological systems.
